data.title: Fun Nightlife with great atmosphere!
data.text: The drinks are great! The food is great! Mostly salsa type Music makes for a fun evening! Make sure you get a mojito!

data.title: Fun place w/ a lot of activity
data.text: Cocktails were yummy - service was a little slow at the bar but friendly.  Lively environment with outdoor seating available!

data.title: I Didn't Think This Was Possible
data.text: If you love tasteless food, small portions, and high prices... RUSH IMMEDIATELY to Tapas! The food looked good but they forgot to add flavor! The menu has no pictures so beware of small portion sizes! The calamari was fried well but no seasoning! The empanadas were smaller than dumplings and costs the same as a gourmet burger in Red Robin! (Shout out to Red Robin) The Chicken Tikka Marsala tasted like rice and tomato juice! The chicken tastes like it came from canned noodles! (As a note, I was STARVING when I got food and I still was very unhappy! I could only imagine if I was only a bit hungry!)

data.title: From dingy bar to hip restaurant
data.text:
From dingy bar to hip little restaurant. This is a MUST try, especially for a date night. The downstairs dining had a romantic feel and if the weather is nice, you can even eat on a little patio that is straight out of Europe! 

If you're looking for recommendations on food: calamari for the win!!

data.title: A PLACES CALL HOME.
data.text: This a wonderful place to spend a nice evening. When i moved to this city and I went for the first time , they made me fell like part of a big family. the waiters , where very helpful with my friends. the food was delicious at a moderate price. The bar serve drinks from many different countries . They play music every Friday at the beautiful patio  . Saturday night they have live band, where you can dance or enjoy a good dinner.I love the warn and friendly atmosphere of this place.

data.title: Great tapas; fresh local ingredients!
data.text: So, I am staying at the Rochester Radisson Riverside, downtown and there really isn't much "dining" to choose from here. (Hockey mom with a child at camp at Bill Gray's Ice Complex, 15 minutes away). However, this little gem, is but a block and a half away, and it is definitely a must-try. The menu is eclectic but everything is made fresh; the portion sizes are perfect for '1' or great as sharing plates. The drinks (I had the mojito--so good on a 90 degree day!) are excellent and so many to choose from. Now the area is 'sketchy' and I am not sure I would park anywhere but underground in a secure garage... but then I stood out like a sore thumb being white, blond and female, by myself. Still, I would venture forth again to this place...they have a lovely little front patio, perfect for those warm summer evenings. If you are staying downtown, or not, this really is a must-try!

data.title: Great Menu
data.text: Went here with my wife for our anniversary.  Hardest part was deciding what to order.  Everything sounded amazing.  We ended up sitting at the bar and ordered 4 or 5 small plates instead of sitting down for dinner.  Tuna Tartare and Chorizo Mussels were my favorite but it was all very good.  They also had an interesting cocktail menu and the drinks were made perfectly.  This is definitely a place you want to check out when you are in Rochester.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: What a Gem!  You would never guess such a gem existed in this Location.  The atmosphere was great, the service even better!  The Food was fabulous, and so many choices.  There was truly something for everyone.  Rochester is not a place I would choose to visit,but I will definitely return to this restaurant.

data.title: So many choices!
data.text: We went here on a whim the other night and I had such a good time. There's so many choices it was hard to pick only a couple. We all got a couple plates and shared. Our server was very patient and helpful and offered us bread when we told him we were in town for a half marathon. A lot of legitimately good vegetarian options for tapas. The portions are smallish(tapas means small plates), but I was still very full from sharing with everyone. I thought the prices were reasonable on food and drinks for the type of food and restaurant it is. I loved the decor and the overall feel of the place. Very cute and enjoyable. I would recommend.

data.title: A destination without leaving town
data.text: Ever just feel like doing SOMETHING but seems like there's nothing going on? Step into Tapas. Its got a particular ambiance that is casual with a touch of romance. Or maybe that's not quite the right word but its one of those places where dining is an experience to be savored. Pricey for sure although that could be why they keep the standard of service so high. Great spot to have a special cocktail with friends or for date night. My one negative is that I saw dusty spots and the walls etc. could use a refreshing scrub. Clean is sexy.

data.title: Interesting and fun, Would be very good if not for prices and portions!
data.text:
My wife and I enjoyed the décor, the fun feel of the place and the concept of tapas.  You have a big city feel when eating here with a variety of flavors to choose from and a mix of ages.

Downsides are that the tapas are a pit pricy and the portion size a bit slow.  Service was okay, we were a two-top that sat next to a table of twenty so several things were missed or forgotten due to more attention provided to the higher tip potential next to us.

The calypso shrimp tasted a bit undercooked yet had a good presentation, the fried calamari was very good, the seared scallops (three medium sized) were good yet came with a price of $21, and the chicken breast salad (forgot the name) was good as well.

If the prices were closer to $10 with a few under and the portion sizes a bit larger, everything would have made perfect sense.  I did leave hungry.  Also, if your tapas are going to be $10 and up, then don't charge for the dipping oil that goes with a basket of bread---leaves a bad taste so to speak.    Drinks were good, ran a bit late and were in the $8 and up league.  Big city prices, for ROC.  Four tapas, two drinks each, bill came to 100 plus tip.

data.title: The best!
data.text: My most recent visit at Tapas 177 I sat on the first floor where the bar is and had the most amazing mojito. There isn't anywhere in the city that makes one as great as Tapas.

data.title: Good not outstanding
data.text:
We used to go to Tapas 177 years ago. It had a creative menu if superb food. You felt like you were in a big city without big city prices. Every meal was outstanding there. Like many people we try other places and had not gone to Tapas for a few years. On Saturday we went to GEVA Theater to see a play and decided to go to Tapas 177 after. 
     The place has the same interesting decor. We found a parking place right away and we're off to a great start. The service was excellent. The food was good but not superb as it used to be. Not a memorable top shelf experience. Again. Each meal was good, well prepared and displayed but not great and far from memorable. We will try it again as a chef can have a good night or an off night. Unfortunately at this time we cannot give it a high level rating.

data.title: Always a favorite for us
data.text: Tapas has been in this location for years and we have always enjoyed the food. Note - it is not "Spanish" food, but has an international variety of items.  We usually go during the week so have not had to deal with the large crowds and long waits that some others have described in their reviews. We usually order the "small plates" so we can try multiple items. On the most recent visit we had the steamed mussels and parmesan fries (steamed with sausage, asparagus, wine and tomato), the fresh vegetable and avocado spring roll (loved the peanut and coconut dipping sauce) and the bulgogi. We finished with a dessert - a banana wrapped in a tortilla, fried until crispy, with vanilla ice cream and cinnamon whipped cream. Wow. Our server was excellent, and the food came out at a leisurely pace so we could enjoy each item with our wine, and have relaxed dining and conversation. An added bonus is that on Mondays there is a selection of $15 bottles of wine, or you can bring your own with no corkage fee. We will continue to go back.

data.title: Great Food, Atmosphere, and Service
data.text: Five of us went for dinner to try their tapas dishes. We thoroughly enjoyed trying a variety of different tapas menu items. Evening was very enjoyable. Atmosphere was terrific and service was excellent. Food was very good. We also enjoyed a variety of drinks and shared a couple desserts. Every dish was well prepared and delicious. Only reservation was that it was a bit pricey, but we still enjoyed everything. Neighborhood is not the greatest, but they have valet parking. Would definitely go back again. Nice evening out and would highly recommend tapas dishes if you have several people in your party. Have also been here before for wine tastings which were always excellent, again with a great atmosphere and terrific service.

data.title: Great service and decent food but not a tapas bar
data.text: I have given this restaurant a 4 star because in the law of averages probably it deserves it, but certainly I was not as impressed as the average Tripadvisor community. Positives: good atmosphere, decent healthy food, great service. Negative this is not a tapas bar, more a Mediterranean restaurant, good is not Spanish, portions are too big to be tapas and prices are too high to taste a lot of dishes that is the principles of Spanish Tapas. Not bad but not great either

data.title: Friendly bar with great food
data.text: Wide selection of tasty tapas style dishes. Gluten free menu was a nice touch. Well stocked bar with a decent wine list. It looked like there was a more formal dinning area downstairs.

data.title: Would give it a 4.5 out of 5
data.text: Wife and I had date night there. Bar is always full and fun. Bartenders very attentive. Wife loved Tapas Spritz! Dinner was great. We split a bunch of small plates. Highlight was the Coconut Curry soup. Korean short ribs were wonderful. Rest of plates were very good. Service and atmosphere were very nice. Everyone there (including customers) were very happy and friendly. Great vibe! Valet parking is great option. Host who has been there forever knows his stuff!

data.title: Always my #1
data.text: Since I moved back to Rochester 15+ years ago, Tapas has been my #1 for date night or a night out with the girls. The music, the atmosphere and kind wait staff/bartenders make it what it is. The food is consistently prepared and I have my favorites (fried calamari salad is great; the chips and salsa at the bar are the best in town).

data.title: DON'T GO TO TAPAS
data.text: I asked how much are shots were.  The bartender responded $5.00.  I replied "really? That seems like a lot."  Next thing I know the owner/bartender Dimitrio told me I was too drunk to be served.  I had three beers before I got there.  He then told my brother in-law that he didn't want other people to hear me say anything.  Jerk!  So i went next door and spent my money at Scotland lard yard
